author: seamonkey82
content:
I used both the hackmd guide and Remy's as a reference, but the vast majority of my configuration doesn't match up with Remy's guide.  Nonetheless, I tried to provide some notes to help others until Remy adds validator configuration to his guide.  
https://www.reddit.com/r/ethstaker/comments/riacuf/the_kintsugi_public_merge_testnet_is_live_and/hp44rhz/

author: seamonkey82
content:
Mostly running smoothly, but just happened to catch this in my validator log.
`Dec 19 00:37:28.002 CRIT Error during attestation routine        slot: 19362, committee_index: 16, error: "All endpoints failed http://localhost:5053/ => RequestFailed(\"Failed to produce attestation data: ServerMessage(ErrorMessage { code: 500, message: \\\"INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR: optimistic head hash 0x77bd51fee236d3a4aba8935bfac8fb8bd0ac752a7df2a60024569a721dd67f80 has not been verified by the execution layer\\\", stacktraces: [] })\")", service: attestation`

author: seamonkey82
content: Looks like a succession of `blockhash mismatch` errors in the eth1 node caused both nodes to fall out of sync temporarily.

author: parithosh
content:
I see the same on one of my lighthouse-geth nodes (`lighthouse-geth-6`). It'd be great if someone from <@&595683849225240704> and or <@!360491619402776577>  can look into it whenever you have time. 

`lighthouse-geth-6` still fails to produce slots and shows this in the logs:
```
Dec 19 12:44:56.005 CRIT Failed to produce sync contribution     error: All endpoints failed http://127.0.0.1:4000/ => Unavailable(Offline), http://127.0.0.1:4000/ => RequestFailed(ServerMessage(ErrorMessage { code: 500, message: "INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR: optimistic head hash 0x3dc6cce3401e66621a72c0eb208bd4c27375761e04b2cbdc021668b30c4197d1 has not been verified by the execution layer", stacktraces: [] })), beacon_block_root: 0x1faf5da70d152f48eb4bae679aa2d27ab669f2ed20aabebc87f46676ea299859, slot: 21499, service: sync_committee
```

seeing the same on another random lighthouse-geth node `kintsugi-lighthouse-geth-21`. Seems like it could be a pattern.

Testnet is still finalising as expected, so it could be some edge case that was triggered.

author: parithosh
content: by comparison i don't see any negative logs on `teku` nodes, so it could be related to optimistic sync.

author: parithosh
content: (these lighthouse-geth nodes haven't been touched since genesis, so the issue seems to have manifested during regular network operation)
